item.description:
This hike is the second hike in the Five-Park Hiking Challenge. 

Join Amy Wilmot, a DCR interpreter and myself on a moderate 5-mile hike in Massasoit State Park. This park, 1500 acres in size, is heavily wooded, comprising mostly oak and white pine forests. The centerpiece of this park is Lake Rico and we will follow the shores of part of this lake. The hike will also visit Kings, Furnace, Middle and Big Bearhole Ponds and several marshy areas which are prime habitats for waterfowl.  We will share some interesting information and discuss unique features that this park has to offer.

Meet at the main parking lot at 9:45. Hike will start promptly at 10:00AM. The hike is for adults who can walk at a moderate pace. Bring water, a lunch and bug spray for ticks. Well-behaved dogs are welcome on an 8-foot or shorter leash (no expandable leashes please).  For additional information, call (508) 866-2580 x161. We will hike rain or shine. If weather conditions are severe, call for cancellation update. 

 

Directions:

From Middleboro rotary on RT 44, Take RT 18 South for about .8 mile to Taunton Street at flashing light.  Turn right onto Taunton Street which after 1.4 miles becomes Middleboro Ave. Park entrance will be on the left, about 2.5 miles from the flashing light.  The park is in East Taunton.

If coming from RT 495, take Exit 5 and follow RT 18 south to Taunton St.

Other hikes we have planned:

Saturday, April 13th F. Gilbert Hills State Forest, Foxboro

Saturday, May 18th Wompatuck State Park, Hingham

Saturday, June 1st Borderland State Park, Easton
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at park entrance parking lot.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Massasoit State Park - Hike 2 of five Park Challenge
